0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Cystinosis, Corneal cysteine crystal accumulation: INSTILL 1 drop of 0.44% ophthalmic solution in each eye every waking hour

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Cystinosis, Corneal cysteine crystal accumulation: INSTILL 1 drop of 0.44% ophthalmic solution in each eye every waking hour

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• contamination of dropper tip may occur; do not touch to eyelids or other areas and keep bottle tightly closed when not in use
  • intracranial hypertension, benign, has been reported; all patients were receiving oral therapy or concomitant oral and ophthalmic therapy
  • to report suspected adverse reactions, contact the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Cysteamine: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Neurologic:Headache (greater than or equal to 10%)
  • Ophthalmic:Eye irritation, Pain in eye, Photophobia (greater than or equal to 10%), Red eye (greater than or equal to 10%), Visual field defect (greater than or equal to 10%)
Serious
Neurologic:Pseudotumor cerebri

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Cysteamine hydrochloride reduces corneal cystine crystal accumulation by converting cystine to cysteine and cysteine-cysteamine mixed disulfides

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Ophthalmic
remove contact lenses prior to administration; may reinsert 15 minutes following administration

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: decrease in corneal cystine crystal accumulation indicates efficacy
